Method Detail

gitReset

public GitResetResponse gitReset(java.io.File repository)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitReset
Perform a reset on the repository. The results of this method are what one would get by running "e;git-reset"e; against the repository.

Specified by:
gitReset in interface IGitReset
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to perform reset against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results of the reset.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

gitReset

public GitResetResponse gitReset(java.io.File repository,
                                 GitResetOptions options)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitReset
Perform a reset on the repository.

Specified by:
gitReset in interface IGitReset
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to perform reset against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
options - The options for a git-reset command. If the value is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results of the reset.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

gitReset

public GitResetResponse gitReset(java.io.File repository,
                                 Ref commitName,
                                 java.util.List<java.io.File> paths)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 JavaGitException
Description copied from interface: IGitReset
Perform a reset on the repository.

Specified by:
gitReset in interface IGitReset
Parameters:
repository - A File instance for the path to the repository root (the parent directory of the .git directory) or a sub-directory in the working tree of the repository to perform reset against. This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
commitName - The name of the commit to reset to. If the value is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
paths - A list of paths to folders or files to reset. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-null and non-empty list is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results of the reset.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
JavaGitException - Thrown when there is an error making the commit.

Perform a reset on the repository.

gitReset in interface IGitReset
Parameters:

This argument must represent the absolute path to the desired directory as returned by the File.getPath() method. If null is passed, a NullPointerException will be thrown.
paths - A list of paths to folders or files to reset. The paths specified in this list must all be relative to the path specified in the repository parameter as returned by File.getPath(). A non-null and non-empty list is required for this parameter, otherwise a NullPointerException or IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
Returns:
The results of the reset.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - There are many reasons for which an IOException may be thrown. Examples include:
  • a directory doesn't exist
  • access to a file is denied
  • a command is not found on the PATH
